title-group.article-title: Energy Absorption Material Selection Methodology for Head/A-Pillar

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1987 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The objectives of this paper are to establish a reasonable procedure for padding selection (for head/A-pillar protection) and to demonstrate how the procedure would be applied in a particular vehicle. The objectives are met by a four step procedure: 1. Theoretical analysis of material properties and the effect of padding materials on head responses, 2. Static or quasi-static and dynamic evaluations of the material properties, 3. Preliminary evaluation of the protective capabilities of the materials by simulated A-pillar component testing, and 4. Final evalution of the most promising material candidate by component testing the material installed on the upper A-pillar of a 1981 Chevrolet Citation.4

ref.mixed-citation: R.A. Saul, M. Farson, and D.A. Guenther, "Component Head Test Accident Reconstruction Feasibility Analysis", Final Report of Project SRL-73, January 1986

R.A Galganski, "Study of Occupant Impact with Vehicle Interior Surfaces: Methodology Development and Baseline Data", SAE Paper # 851733 Presented at 29th Stapp Car Crash Conference, October 9-11, 1985; also Fourth Progress Report of Contract # DTNH22-83-C-07011 , Project # 7154-V, same title and author.

C.C. Chou and G.W. Nyquist, "Analytical Studies of the Head Injury Criterion (HIC)", Presented at the Automotive Engineering Congress, Detroit, MI, February 1974; also published in the Crash Test Times, Volume I, Number 4, by the Endevco Corp.
D.W. Willke and M.W. Monk, "Side Interior Stiffness Measurement", DOT Report No. DOT HS 806-708, September 1984.
